verses.roman:
ei-mata kalā, āmra, nāraṅga, kāṅṭhāla
yāhā yāhā dūra-grāme śuniyāche bhāla

synonyms: ei-mata—in this way; kalā—bananas; āmra—mangoes; nāraṅga—oranges; kāṅṭhāla—jackfruit; yāhā yāhā—whatever; dūra-grāme—in distant villages; śuniyāche—he heard; bhāla—good.
translation: "In this way he collected excellent bananas, mangoes, oranges, jackfruits and whatever first-class fruits from distant villages he had heard about.
